comment.author: 42285996@N00
comment._content: Love the matching hair and outfits on the girls.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: A New York Times report on the America vs. England polo match, held at Meadow Brook, near Hempstead, Long Island, on June 14, tells us that the Goadby Loew girls all wore white on that occasion also.

comment.author: 44113651@N00
comment._content: The girls are, left to right, Florence (1901), Evelyn (1903) and Barbara (1899). The youngest Winifred was born in 1909, so I assume would have been too young to attend.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
Birstall46:

Thanks for the further identifications of the daughters in the photograph. We will update the record with more information.

comment.author: 44113651@N00
comment._content: Oh you are welcome, they distant cousins of mine so I have a family history interest.
